docs.abstract: A California woman says that products targeted at African-Americans are locked up in her neighborhood store.
docs.snippet: A California woman says that products targeted at African-Americans are locked up in her neighborhood store.
docs.lead_paragraph: A California woman has sued Walmart, accusing the nationwide chain of racial discrimination because her local store keeps African-American personal care products locked up in a glass case.

headline.main: Walmart’s Locking Up of Certain Beauty Products Is Racial Discrimination, Suit Claims

docs.abstract: Called Meltdown, the first and most urgent flaw affects nearly all microprocessors made by Intel. The second, Spectre, affects most other chips.
docs.snippet: Called Meltdown, the first and most urgent flaw affects nearly all microprocessors made by Intel. The second, Spectre, affects most other chips.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Computer security experts have discovered two major security flaws in the microprocessors inside nearly all of the world’s computers.

headline.main: Researchers Discover Two Major Flaws in the World’s Computers
headline.print_headline: 2 Big Flaws Discovered In Nearly All Computers

byline.original: By Cade Metz and Nicole Perlroth

docs.abstract: At the company’s annual developer conference, Mr. Zuckerberg, its chief executive, unveiled new products and features. “We have to a responsibility to move forward,” he said.
docs.snippet: At the company’s annual developer conference, Mr. Zuckerberg, its chief executive, unveiled new products and features. “We have to a responsibility to move forward,” he said.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Mark Zuckerberg has faced scandal after scandal in recent months. On Tuesday, he indicated he was ready to move on and continue Facebook’s march of taking over people’s online lives.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg Has a Message: Facebook Will Keep Building
headline.print_headline: Facebook Says It Will Keep Conquering the Online World

byline.original: By Sheera Frenkel and Cade Metz

docs.abstract: Salaries for artificial intelligence researchers at big tech companies are skyrocketing, luring many professors.
docs.snippet: Salaries for artificial intelligence researchers at big tech companies are skyrocketing, luring many professors.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — At a conference in Silicon Valley this week, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, vowed that his company would “keep building” despite a swirl of questions around the way it has dealt with misinformation and the personal data of its users.

headline.main: Facebook Adds A.I. Labs in Seattle and Pittsburgh, Pressuring Local Universities

docs.abstract: The building blocks of artificial intelligence are becoming more affordable and easier to work with. A new report explains why that opens the door to additional risks.
docs.snippet: The building blocks of artificial intelligence are becoming more affordable and easier to work with. A new report explains why that opens the door to additional risks.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A Silicon Valley start-up recently unveiled a drone that can set a course entirely on its own. A handy smartphone app allows the user to tell the airborne drone to follow someone. Once the drone starts tracking, its subject will find it remarkably hard to shake.

headline.main: Good News: A.I. Is Getting Cheaper. That’s Also Bad News.
headline.print_headline: Good News: A.I. Is Cheaper. That’s Also Bad News.

docs.abstract: Forty-five young companies are building processors just for artificial intelligence. At least five have raised more than $100 million from investors.
docs.snippet: Forty-five young companies are building processors just for artificial intelligence. At least five have raised more than $100 million from investors.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For years, tech industry financiers showed little interest in start-up companies that made computer chips.

headline.main: Big Bets on A.I. Open a New Frontier for Chip Start-Ups, Too
headline.print_headline: Bets on A.I. Open a New Chip Frontier

docs.abstract: The tech companies vowed this week to stamp out conspiracy videos and misinformation on the Parkland, Fla., shooting. So far, they are falling short.
docs.snippet: The tech companies vowed this week to stamp out conspiracy videos and misinformation on the Parkland, Fla., shooting. So far, they are falling short.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — On Wednesday, one week after the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., Facebook and YouTube vowed to crack down on the trolls.

headline.main: Facebook and Google Struggle to Squelch ‘Crisis Actor’ Posts
headline.print_headline: Lies Elude the Promises of Online Giants to Do Better in Stamping Them Out

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School (Parkland, Fla)

byline.original: By Jack Nicas and Sheera Frenkel

docs.abstract: Mark Pincus, founder of the gaming company Zynga, is reducing his voting power over the company, going against a trend where entrepreneurs lobbied for more control.
docs.snippet: Mark Pincus, founder of the gaming company Zynga, is reducing his voting power over the company, going against a trend where entrepreneurs lobbied for more control.
docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, some of the best known technology companies, including Google, Facebook and Snap, have sold shares to the public while maintaining a corporate structure that allowed their founders to keep tight control over their companies.

headline.main: Tech Founders Embraced Control Over Companies. This One Is Giving It Up.
headline.print_headline: In Rare Step for a Founder, Zynga’s Is Ceding Control

byline.original: By Nick Wingfield and Jack Nicas

docs.abstract: People are increasingly calling for boycotts of the big tech companies amid a backlash. The problem is that Facebook, Apple, Amazon and Google are nearly inescapable.
docs.snippet: People are increasingly calling for boycotts of the big tech companies amid a backlash. The problem is that Facebook, Apple, Amazon and Google are nearly inescapable.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Ryan Knight, a Democratic activist in Los Angeles, called for a boycott of Apple in February because it hadn’t responded to calls to delete a channel from the National Rifle Association from its streaming-video service after the Parkland, Fla., school shooting.

headline.main: They Tried to Boycott Facebook, Apple and Google. They Failed.

docs.abstract: Amazon has surprised officials in cities vying for the company’s new headquarters by asking how to avoid soaring housing costs and paralyzing traffic.
docs.snippet: Amazon has surprised officials in cities vying for the company’s new headquarters by asking how to avoid soaring housing costs and paralyzing traffic.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — When 10 representatives from Amazon visited the Denver area in late January, they did what you’d expect from a company scouting for a place to put its second headquarters. They toured more than a half-dozen potential sites for a new campus and talked about the technical talent available in the area.

headline.main: One Goal of Amazon’s HQ2: Learn the Lessons of Seattle
